name: Procurement Cost Optimizer Tool
description: A data-driven solution to optimize supplier planning for torque tube projects across North America. It automates forecast allocations, reduces landed costs, and supports strategic sourcing decisions.

appStages.name: Introduction
appStages.stageDetails:
{ "components": [ { "label": "HTML", "attrs": [ { "attr": "", "value": "" } ], "content": "

Procurement Cost Optimizer

Overview

This analytical application is designed to optimize procurement planning for solar torque tubes by minimizing overall costs while ensuring that business demands are met across multiple periods. The solution integrates supplier cost structures, demand constraints, transportation logistics, and supplier quality metrics into a unified decision-making framework.

Key Features

  • + Demand Forecasting: Distribute total demand across periods within constraints
  • + Supplier Optimization: Evaluate suppliers based on cost, capacity, and defect rates
  • + Logistics Planning: Optimize transportation strategy and shipping costs

Key Insights

  • + Cost Optimization: Identify lowest-cost suppliers with minimal defect rates.
  • + Capacity Planning: Match supplier capabilities with product demand distribution.
  • + Demand Efficiency: Optimize order quantities against production constraints.
", "refreshOnChange": false, "key": "html1", "type": "htmlelement", "input": false, "tableView": false }, { "label": "HTML", "attrs": [ { "attr": "", "value": "" } ], "content": "
", "refreshOnChange": false, "key": "html2", "type": "htmlelement", "input": false, "tableView": false }, { "label": "Columns", "columns": [ { "components": [], "width": 6, "offset": 0, "push": 0, "pull": 0, "size": "md", "currentWidth": 6 }, { "components": [ { "label": "Get Started", "action": "event", "showValidations": false, "theme": "info", "rightIcon": "fa fa-arrow-right", "customClass": " mt-0 float-right btn-outline rounded", "tableView": false, "key": "next", "type": "button", "event": "next", "input": true, "hideOnChildrenHidden": false } ], "width": 6, "offset": 0, "push": 0, "pull": 0, "size": "md", "currentWidth": 6 } ], "key": "columns1", "type": "columns", "input": false, "tableView": false, "keyModified": true }, { "label": "HTML", "attrs": [ { "attr": "", "value": "" } ], "content": "

Supplier Planning Optimization Tool

SPO

Overview

This analytical application is designed to optimize procurement planning for solar torque tubes by minimizing overall costs while ensuring that business demands are met across multiple periods. The solution integrates supplier cost structures, demand constraints, transportation logistics, and supplier quality metrics into a unified decision-making framework.

Key Features

  • + Demand Forecasting: Distribute total demand across periods within constraints.
  • + Supplier Optimization: Evaluate suppliers based on cost, capacity, and defect rates.
  • + Logistics Planning: Optimize transportation strategy and shipping costs.

Key Insights

  • + Cost Optimization: Identify lowest-cost suppliers with minimal defect rates.
  • + Capacity Planning: Match supplier capabilities with product demand distribution.
  • + Demand Efficiency: Optimize order quantities against production constraints.
", "refreshOnChange": false, "hidden": true, "key": "html", "type": "htmlelement", "input": false, "tableView": false, "keyModified": true } ] }

appStages.name: Data-Preparation
appStages.stageDetails:
{ "components": [ { "label": "HTML", "attrs": [ { "attr": "", "value": "" } ], "content": "

Data Preparation

Guide To Using The App

  • + Select Dataset to Prepare to view Description
  • + Use the Buttons to Prepare the datasets
  • + Demand Data needs Project data to be created 1st
  • + Supplier Project Master Table is required for preparing Supplier ,Product and Supplier Product Price table
", "refreshOnChange": false, "key": "html2", "type": "htmlelement", "input": false, "tableView": false }, { "label": "HTML", "attrs": [ { "attr": "", "value": "" } ], "content": "

Datasets

", "refreshOnChange": false, "key": "html5", "type": "htmlelement", "input": false, "tableView": false }, { "label": "Radio", "optionsLabelPosition": "right", "customClass": "border p-3 rounded m-3", "inline": true, "hideLabel": true, "tableView": false, "defaultValue": "projects", "values": [ { "label": "Projects", "value": "projects", "shortcut": "" }, { "label": "Demand", "value": "demand", "shortcut": "" }, { "label": "Supplier", "value": "supplierData", "shortcut": "" }, { "label": "Product ", "value": "product", "shortcut": "" }, { "label": "Suppliers Product Price table", "value": "suppliersProductPriceTable", "shortcut": "" }, { "label": "Project-Supplier", "value": "projectSupplier", "shortcut": "" } ], "key": "radio", "type": "radio", "input": true }, { "label": "HTML", "attrs": [ { "attr": "", "value": "" } ], "content": "

Demand Dataset Description

FIELD NAME DESCRIPTION
Project A unique identifier representing each project where the product is required.
Product A unique identifier for the specific torque tube product required for the project.
ProjectName The name or location of the project site where the product will be delivered.
PartDescription Text description of the torque tube product, including dimensions, module size, thickness, strength (ksi), galvanization type, and any additional specifications.
TotalQuantity The total number of units of the specific product required for the corresponding project.
", "refreshOnChange": false, "key": "html6", "conditional": { "show": true, "when": "radio", "eq": "demand" }, "type": "htmlelement", "input": false, "tableView": false }, { "label": "HTML", "attrs": [ { "attr": "", "value": "" } ], "content": "

Projects Dataset Description

FIELD NAME DESCRIPTION
Project A unique identifier for each project.
lat Latitude coordinate indicating the geographic location of the project.
long Longitude coordinate indicating the geographic location of the project.
Country The country where the project is located. All entries in this dataset are in the United States.
ExpectedCloseDate The date the project was initially expected to be completed. (Format: YYYY-MM-DD)
StartDate The actual start date of the project. (Format: YYYY-MM-DD)
WeekCount The number of weeks the project has taken or is expected to take from the start date.
", "refreshOnChange": false, "key": "html4", "conditional": { "show": true, "when": "radio", "eq": "projects" }, "type": "htmlelement", "input": false, "tableView": false }, { "label": "HTML", "attrs": [ { "attr": "", "value": "" } ], "content": "

Supplier Dataset Description

FIELD NAME DESCRIPTION
lat The geographic latitude coordinate of the supplier's facility location, used for mapping and distance calculations.
long The geographic longitude coordinate of the supplier's facility location.
WeeklyCapacity The maximum number of product units the supplier can produce or deliver in a single week.
State The U.S. state where the supplier's facility is located.
City The city where the supplier’s facility is located.
Supplier Full name of the supplier, including location and state. Identifies the production facility.
YearlyMinOrder The minimum number of product units the supplier must be allocated across the year. Ensures supplier engagement in procurement plans.
", "refreshOnChange": false, "key": "html7", "conditional": { "show": true, "when": "radio", "eq": "supplierData" }, "type": "htmlelement", "input": false, "tableView": false }, { "label": "HTML", "attrs": [ { "attr": "", "value": "" } ], "content": "

Product Dataset Description

FIELD NAME DESCRIPTION
Product Unique identifier for the product, typically linked to specific tube configurations or SKUs.
Length The length of the torque tube product in meters. Critical for transport and bundling calculations.
Thickness Wall thickness of the torque tube product in millimeters. Affects strength and weight.
BundleSize Number of torque tubes included in a single bundle. Used in calculating load capacity and truck optimization.
Weight Weight of a single bundle in kilograms. Critical for ensuring truck weight limits are not exceeded.
BundleQtyPerFlatbed Maximum number of bundles of this product that can be loaded on a single flatbed truck.
", "refreshOnChange": false, "key": "html", "conditional": { "show": true, "when": "radio", "eq": "product" }, "type": "htmlelement", "input": false, "tableView": false }, { "label": "HTML", "attrs": [ { "attr": "", "value": "" } ], "content": "

Suppliers Product Price Dataset Description

FIELD NAME DESCRIPTION
Supplier The name and location of the supplier providing the product. Used to determine procurement options and regional sourcing constraints.
Product The unique identifier for the product that the supplier can provide. Used to map products to suppliers.
WeeklyCapacity The maximum number of units the supplier can deliver each week for the given product. Used for capacity planning and supply constraints.
CostPerUnit The cost per unit charged by the supplier for the given product. Used to calculate total procurement cost in optimization models.
", "refreshOnChange": false, "key": "html1", "conditional": { "show": true, "when": "radio", "eq": "suppliersProductPriceTable" }, "type": "htmlelement", "input": false, "tableView": false }, { "label": "HTML", "attrs": [ { "attr": "", "value": "" } ], "content": "

Project-Supplier Dataset Description

FIELD NAME DESCRIPTION
ProjectId Unique identifier representing the project associated with the supplier trip.
Supplier_Name Name of the supplier and their location (State and City).
RatePerMile Cost rate charged per mile by the supplier for transporting goods.
Distance Distance (in miles) the goods need to be transported from supplier to site.
", "refreshOnChange": false, "key": "html8", "conditional": { "show": true, "when": "radio", "eq": "projectSupplier" }, "type": "htmlelement", "input": false, "tableView": false }, { "label": "Columns", "columns": [ { "components": [], "width": 3, "offset": 0, "push": 0, "pull": 0, "size": "md", "currentWidth": 3 }, { "components": [], "width": 1, "offset": 0, "push": 0, "pull": 0, "size": "md", "currentWidth": 1 }, { "components": [], "size": "md", "width": 3, "offset": 0, "push": 0, "pull": 0, "currentWidth": 3 }, { "components": [], "size": "md", "width": 3, "offset": 0, "push": 0, "pull": 0, "currentWidth": 3 }, { "components": [ { "label": "Initiate Data Preparation", "action": "event", "showValidations": false, "theme": "info", "customClass": "float-right btn-outline rounded ", "tableView": false, "key": "demand4", "properties": { "wfId": "43e21182-4e5c-4314-86fa-48cb675ae707" }, "type": "button", "event": "execute", "input": true } ], "size": "md", "width": 2, "offset": 0, "push": 0, "pull": 0, "currentWidth": 2 } ], "customClass": "m-2", "key": "columns2", "type": "columns", "input": false, "tableView": false }, { "label": "Columns", "columns": [ { "components": [], "width": 6, "offset": 0, "push": 0, "pull": 0, "size": "md", "currentWidth": 6 }, { "components": [ { "label": "View Datasets", "action": "event", "showValidations": false, "theme": "info", "customClass": "float-right btn-outline rounded", "tableView": false, "key": "execute", "type": "button", "event": "execute", "input": true } ], "width": 6, "offset": 0, "push": 0, "pull": 0, "size": "md", "currentWidth": 6 } ], "hidden": true, "key": "columns", "type": "columns", "input": false, "tableView": false }, { "label": "HTML", "attrs": [ { "attr": "", "value": "" } ], "content": "
", "refreshOnChange": false, "key": "html3", "type": "htmlelement", "input": false, "tableView": false }, { "label": "Columns", "columns": [ { "components": [ { "label": "Go Back", "action": "event", "showValidations": false, "theme": "secondary", "customClass": "btn-outline mt-0 float-left", "tableView": false, "key": "back", "type": "button", "event": "back", "input": true } ], "width": 6, "offset": 0, "push": 0, "pull": 0, "size": "md", "currentWidth": 6 }, { "components": [ { "label": "Next", "action": "event", "showValidations": false, "theme": "info", "customClass": "float-right rounded", "tableView": false, "key": "next", "properties": { "clearResult": "true" }, "type": "button", "event": "next", "input": true } ], "width": 6, "offset": 0, "push": 0, "pull": 0, "size": "md", "currentWidth": 6 } ], "customClass": "p-3", "key": "columns1", "type": "columns", "input": false, "tableView": false } ] }

appStages.stageDetails:

      "content": "\u003cdiv style\u003d\"border-radius: 5px; font-family: \u0027Roboto\u0027, sans-serif;margin:-30px -18px 15px -18px;\"\u003e\r\n    \u003cdiv style\u003d\"padding: 0.75rem 1.25rem; margin-bottom: 0; background-color: #fff;\r\n    border-bottom: 1px solid rgba(30, 30, 30, 0.125); border-top-right-radius: 5px; border-top-left-radius: 5px;\r\n    color: #ffffff; display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 20px;\"\u003e\r\n        \r\n        \u003ch3 style\u003d\"color: #1E1E1E; font-size: 28px; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 20px;\"\u003eDataset Overview\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n    \u003c/div\u003e\r\n\r\n    \u003cdiv style\u003d\"margin-top: 20px;\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\r\n\r\n    \u003cdiv style\u003d\"margin-top: 20px;margin-left:40px\"\u003e\r\n        \u003ch4 style\u003d\"color: #023E8A; font-size: 20px;margin-bottom:15px; font-weight: 400;\"\u003eGuide To Using The App\u003c/h4\u003e\r\n                \u003cul style\u003d\"margin-left: 10px; list-style-type: none; padding: 0;\"\u003e\r\n            \u003cli style\u003d\"position: relative; margin-bottom: 10px; padding-left: 30px; color: #000000; font-size: 16px; margin-left: -20px;\"\u003e\r\n                \u003cspan style\u003d\"width: 13px; height: 13px; background-color: #ADE8F2 !important; color: #fff; \r\n                    border-radius: 50%; position: absolute; left: 10px; top: 5px; display: flex; \r\n                    align-items: center; justify-content: center; font-size: 10px; font-weight: bold;\"\u003e+\u003c/span\u003e\r\n                 Click \"View Datasets\" to display the dataset info.\r\n            \u003c/li\u003e\r\n        \u003c/ul\u003e\r\n    \u003c/div\u003e\r\n\r\n   \u003cdiv class\u003d\"mt-3\"\u003e\r\n    \u003ch4 style\u003d\"color: #023E8A; font-size: 20px; margin-left: 42px; font-weight: 400; margin-bottom: 20px;\"\u003eFeature Columns \u0026 Their Description\u003c/h4\u003e\r\n\u003c/h4\u003e\r\n    \u003cdiv style\u003d\"overflow: auto; margin-top: -9px; margin-left: 42px\"\u003e\r\n        \u003ctable class\u003d\"table\" style\u003d\"width: 99.5%; border-collapse: separate; border-spacing: 0; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7; border-radius: 8px;\"\u003e\r\n            \u003cthead\u003e\r\n                \u003ctr style\u003d\"color: #000000; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7; border-top-right-radius: 8px; border-top-left-radius: 8px;\"\u003e\r\n                    \u003cth scope\u003d\"col\" style\u003d\"color: #000000; font-size: 16px; padding: 8px; background-color: #EEEEEE; text-align: left; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7; border-top-left-radius: 8px;\"\u003eFIELD NAME\u003c/th\u003e\r\n                    \u003cth scope\u003d\"col\" style\u003d\"color: #000000; font-size: 16px; padding: 8px; background-color: #EEEEEE; text-align: left; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7; border-top-right-radius: 8px;\"\u003eDESCRIPTION\u003c/th\u003e\r\n                \u003c/tr\u003e\r\n            \u003c/thead\u003e\r\n                                \u003ctbody class\u003d\"small\"\u003e\r\n                    \u003ctr style\u003d\"border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003e\r\n                        \u003ctd style\u003d\"color: #000000; font-size: 16px; padding: 8px; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003eSuppliers\u003c/td\u003e\r\n                        \u003ctd style\u003d\"color: #000000; font-size: 16px; padding: 8px; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003eContains information about each supplier, including their name and the minimum number of units they must supply during the planning period. This helps ensure that suppliers are engaged in the allocation.\u003c/td\u003e\r\n                    \u003c/tr\u003e\r\n                    \u003ctr style\u003d\"border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003e\r\n                        \u003ctd style\u003d\"color: #000000; font-size: 16px; padding: 8px; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003eSuppliers Product Price\u003c/td\u003e\r\n                        \u003ctd style\u003d\"color: #000000; font-size: 16px; padding: 8px; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003eLists which products each supplier can provide and the corresponding cost per unit. This data is used to calculate procurement cost and determine valid supplier-product combinations.\u003c/td\u003e\r\n   \u003c/tr\u003e\r\n                    \u003ctr style\u003d\"border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003e\r\n                        \u003ctd style\u003d\"color: #000000; font-size: 16px; padding: 8px; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003eProducts\u003c/td\u003e\r\n                        \u003ctd style\u003d\"color: #000000; font-size: 16px; padding: 8px; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003eDescribes the physical characteristics of each product, such as its length, weight, and thickness. These attributes are essential for bundling decisions and checking whether the products can be transported within the truck\u0027s space and weight limits.\u003c/td\u003e\r\n                    \u003c/tr\u003e\r\n                    \u003ctr style\u003d\"border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003e\r\n                        \u003ctd style\u003d\"color: #000000; font-size: 16px; padding: 8px; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003eProjects\u003c/td\u003e\r\n                        \u003ctd style\u003d\"color: #000000; font-size: 16px; padding: 8px; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003eIncludes a list of projects, along with the start and end weeks of each one. These weeks define the time window in which deliveries must occur for each project.\u003c/td\u003e\r\n   \u003c/tr\u003e\r\n                    \u003ctr style\u003d\"border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003e\r\n                        \u003ctd style\u003d\"color: #000000; font-size: 16px; padding: 8px; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003eDemand\u003c/td\u003e\r\n                        \u003ctd style\u003d\"color: #000000; font-size: 16px; padding: 8px; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003eSpecifies how many units of each product are required by each project. This is the core input that defines what needs to be fulfilled through the optimization model.\u003c/td\u003e\r\n   \u003c/tr\u003e\r\n                    \u003ctr style\u003d\"border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003e\r\n                        \u003ctd style\u003d\"color: #000000; font-size: 16px; padding: 8px; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003eTrucks\u003c/td\u003e\r\n                        \u003ctd style\u003d\"color: #000000; font-size: 16px; padding: 8px; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003eProvides details about the truck type being used, specifically its total length and maximum weight capacity. Only one type of truck is assumed, and its dimensions are used to enforce shipping constraints.\u003c/td\u003e\r\n    \u003c/tr\u003e\r\n                    \u003ctr style\u003d\"border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003e\r\n                        \u003ctd style\u003d\"color: #000000; font-size: 16px; padding: 8px; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003eSuppliers Projects\u003c/td\u003e\r\n                        \u003ctd style\u003d\"color: #000000; font-size: 16px; padding: 8px; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003eShows which suppliers are allowed to deliver to which projects. It also contains the distance to the project, cost per kilometer, and the minimum and maximum percentage of the project\u0027s total demand that each supplier is allowed to fulfill.\u003c/td\u003e\r\n   \u003c/tr\u003e\r\n                    \u003ctr style\u003d\"border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;\"\u003e\r\n                        \u003ctd style\u003d\"color: #000000; font-size: 16px; padding: 8px; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;border-bottom-left-radius: 8px\"\u003eThickness Capacity\u003c/td\u003e\r\n                        \u003ctd style\u003d\"color: #000000; font-size: 16px; padding: 8px; border: 1px solid #D6D6D7;border-bottom-right-radius: 8px\"\u003eOutlines the weekly production capacity of each supplier, categorized by the thickness of the products they produce. This ensures that a supplier doesn\u0027t exceed their available capacity in any given week for a specific tube thickness.\u003c/td\u003e\r\n   \u003c/tr\u003e\r\n                \u003c/tbody\u003e\r\n            \u003c/table\u003e\r\n        \u003c/div\u003e\r\n        \u003c/div\u003e\r\n\u003c/div\u003e\r\n",
